results.title: Joe and the sleeping beauty
results.brief_description: The Queen Bee, Honeyflower is placed under a spell by One Sting Maude, a witch from the tsetse family, jealous of the Queen Bee’s beauty. Bzz, the Bee-guide enlists the help of Joe to help save the Queen. He is given an injection to shrink him to the size of an insect and enters the parlour of the sleeping beauty, Honeyflower. Written by Frame and Jean Image with music by Michael Emer.

results.title: Joe and Roxy
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Don Haldane
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Adolescence: perspective”.
The second of three dramas on adolescence, this film deals with teenagers in love. Joe and Roxy, at fifteen and sixteen respectively, face more than the usual number of teen-age problems. Roxy, the product of a broken home, tries to keep her romantic illusions alive against her mother’s worry and disappointment in life. Joe turns unsuccessfully to his father, a man of narrow mind and dull sensibilities, to help him decide his future. In their story the film contrasts the teenagers’ need for absolute rules with the confusion of adult standards.

results.title: Joe's party
results.creator_credit: TVA Group Production and Holman Brothers
results.brief_description: Joe is having a party with his family, in a hospital bed, having nearly killed himself in an accident at work. Industrial accidents are invariably caused by failing to exercise care or not observing recognised safety precautions. Shows examples in a stone quarry, but the warnings apply to many industries.

results.title: Jobs for the girls
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Suzanne Davies
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the ways in which young girls are influenced when choosing a job or career. A young woman careers officer describes the factors which affect firls’ attitudes at every level - school, college, and work, and sequences illustrate her statements.

results.title: Job search: the pre-interview
results.brief_description: Through the eyes of three school leavers, we see how jobs are researched using available community resources to obtain work information. Use of the CES, municipal libraries, newspapers and parental advice is covered. The program also covers the correct preparation of job applications.

results.title: Job search: the interview
results.brief_description: This second part of the Job Search series shows three school leavers in an interview and summarises their performance. The successful person is not revealed, leaving this factor open to follow-up group discussion.
